text.text:

Either they should differentiate price for different types of rooms and packages or reduce a little bit overall.

text.text:
The Vivanta Chennai is located on OMR which is close to lots of offices. Hence it is suitable mainly for business travelers.

The rooms are nice, quiet, clean and cozy. However, would have been had they been a bit bigger. There are options for single or double beds. The toilets are good but they lack hair dryers etc. for basic rooms.

The room service and maintenance service is great. The reception and staff is responsive and courteous. The restaurant service was also good.

The breakfast buffet was great in quality, taste and variety. It had lots of Veg and non-veg options. The restaurant area is also good enough for lots of people.

Overall a value for money...

editorialSummary.text: Fashionable rooms & suites in an upmarket hotel offering 3 restaurants & a rooftop pool.

text.text:
Stayed here for around 11 nights on a trip to Chennai earlier this year and safe to say I won’t be staying anywhere else in the future! I love the hospitality of this hotel, and could not recommend it enough. Rooms are spacious and modern, breakfast buffet is great, and the staff go above and beyond to make sure you have a good stay. There’s a small but functional gym which I used quite a bit, as well as a pool that I didn’t get a chance to try.

Again, would like to emphasize the staff in this property are amazing and make you feel so welcomed. They even surprised us with a chocolate cake on my final days breakfast, so sweet!

Very NRI and foreigner friendly. Go ahead and book your stay here, you will not regret it!

text.text: I had an amazing experience at Rain Tree Hotel! The food service was exceptional, with staff being incredibly attentive and friendly throughout my visit especially Chef Bhawani, her explanation was quiet polite. The breakfast buffet was a highlight, offering a fantastic variety of dishes that catered to every taste. From fresh fruit and pastries to hot breakfast options, there was something for everyone! The modern yet cozy decor created a warm and welcoming atmosphere. It was the perfect setting to start the day off right. I highly recommend Rain Tree Hotel for anyone looking for great food, outstanding service, and a comfortable, stylish place to stay. Will definitely be coming back!

text.text:
During my stay at The Raintree, St. Mary’s Road, I had a wonderful dining experience, thanks to Chef Bhavani’s expertise in curating the buffet. Each meal was thoughtfully prepared, with a great variety of flavors that catered to different tastes. One of the standout experiences was trying her special congee drink—it was warm, soothing, and packed with subtle yet rich flavors, making it a perfect start to the day.

I had the opportunity to meet Chef Bhavani, and her passion for food was evident in the way she spoke about her dishes. She ensured that every item on the buffet was fresh, well-balanced, and beautifully presented. Her dedication and warmth added a personal touch to my stay, making the dining experience truly special.

text.text: I was on a business trip....away from home. When I checked in on sat in eve, I was greeted by warm n welcoming smile of Bikram (security) at the entrance. My check in procedure was quick. Rooms are amazing with all amenities one may need. I took tour to the pool. Babesh the swimming coach is so friendly and warm. He spoke about his inspiring experiences. Hotel food is amazing. I preferred the buffer. My attenders sushmita sarita arvind soumik are so caring. They even cut a see you soon cake for me. How heartwarming. They ensure I have what I need and kept checking on me. Everyday while leaving to work, poresh (security) will again greet you with such a positive and Friendly approach. And same was with Bikram when I returned at night. The hotel staff person dhanush even offered me taking treats along when I went to meet my friends. They are so into ensuring they give you options and such a comfortable stay. Chefs are very friendly and smile at you. Chef gopal would make amazing soft rotis for me. Head chef nisarg is super warm n made me handmade icecream...so yummy. My check out was great. devashish gazal mina Lalitha took a picture and also gave me some good bye treats. All in all it felt like a home away from home. ❤️

text.text:
I recently stayed at Regenta Central RS Chennai OMR and had a pleasant overall experience. From check-in to check-out, the hospitality stood out, making my stay both comfortable and convenient.

The location is ideal for business travelers, especially those with meetings along the OMR corridor. It’s well-connected and easy to access from major IT hubs and offices. Despite being on a busy stretch, the hotel maintains a quiet, calm atmosphere inside.

Rooms were modern, clean, and well-maintained, with all the essential amenities—comfortable beds, crisp linens, a well-stocked minibar, and a clean bathroom. Housekeeping was prompt and did a great job every day. The Wi-Fi speed was reliable, which made working from the room seamless.

The restaurant served a good variety of dishes across cuisines, including some authentic South Indian options. The breakfast buffet was especially noteworthy with its range and freshness. Room service was also timely, and the food arrived warm and well-packed.

The staff at the front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant were courteous, professional, and always ready to help. I had a minor issue with the in-room AC, and the team responded quickly to fix it, which I appreciated.

Facilities like the gym and banquet halls seemed well-equipped and clean, though I didn’t have time to use them personally. There’s ample parking as well.

If I were to suggest an area for improvement, it would be to enhance soundproofing between rooms. I occasionally heard hallway noise.

Overall, a solid 4-star property that delivers on expectations. Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, Regenta Central RS is a reliable choice in Chennai OMR. I would happily consider staying here again.

text.text:
Worst Experience Ever! Please read completely before going!

I visited Citrus Café at Lemon Tree, Ramapuram with my fiancée, expecting at least basic professionalism for the money they charge. Instead, it turned out to be the worst dining experience I’ve ever had. A complete waste of time and patience.

I ordered a Greek salad, clearly written in the menu with feta cheese. What arrived after one hour was a bowl of chunky, oversized vegetable pieces drowned in lemon juice, with paneer thrown on top instead of feta. No oregano, no olive oil , basically, it wasn’t a Greek salad at all. The staff never bothered to tell us they didn’t have feta. I had to ask the waitress why there was paneer, only for her to casually say, “We don’t have feta, sir.” No apology, no heads-up, nothing.

The basics are missing here. I asked for grilled peri peri chicken skewers with minimal oil and made it extremely clear that my medical condition doesn’t permit me to eat oily food. What came out of the kitchen was deep fried, not grilled. So their “grilled” skewers are a lie too. The staff just shrugged and said sorry. When I asked for the manager, nobody showed up. The kitchen staff came instead and claimed the manager was “busy”.

I also ordered two lime sodas. They never arrived. After wasting an entire hour waiting for just a salad and a wrongly cooked chicken, I told them I’d pay for the pathetic salad and leave. They refused to even let me pay, acting guilty, but what’s the point? Basic courtesy and competence are missing here.

This place claims to have a decent a la carte menu. The reality is they don’t have half the ingredients, they don’t tell you upfront, and they have zero training to handle basic customer requests.

If you value your time, money, tastebuds, and basic respect, do not step inside Citrus Café at Lemon Tree, Ramapuram. It’s run by incompetent staff, clueless chefs, and a manager who hides when there’s a problem. For a brand like Lemon Tree, this level of service is embarrassing.

Never going back. Strongly NOT recommended.

I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights as a single traveller , there for a conference. My stay was beyond hospitality!! It was so so comfortable. Everything is FIVE STAR !!
1. The ambience: open , clean , welcoming and always smelling so fresh .

Ten stars !! To the hotel . Highly recommend!

text.text:
Hotel Review: Disappointing Experience – Not Worth the Five-Star Tag

I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights, expecting a true five-star experience based on its classification and pricing. Unfortunately, it fell far short of expectations in almost every aspect.

Despite the high price, the services and amenities felt more like a three-star property. There was no lounge area, no lawn space, and no spa, which are basic features you'd expect from any upscale hotel. The room itself was quite compact, and to make matters worse, the mini-fridge wasn’t working. I informed the staff two to three times, but it was never resolved during my stay.

Basic necessities were also missing—no hand towels were provided, and the food quality was subpar. The buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner lacked variety and taste, making dining a rather disappointing experience.

Overall, the hotel does not live up to its five-star status. With its limited amenities, lack of attention to guest concerns, and poor food quality, I would rate it more accurately as a three-star property. Definitely not worth the premium pricing.

Only good thing is behavior of staff, very polite and courteous.

text.text:
Zero-Star Experience – Misleading Promises and Costly Damage

I am writing this review out of sheer frustration and disappointment with my recent stay at Grand Residence. What was supposed to be a simple, hassle-free experience turned into an absolute nightmare due to gross negligence and misleading assurances.

Despite booking this hotel specifically because of the promised parking availability, I was shocked to find there were no usable parking slots on-site. Instead, I was instructed to leave my car outside the hotel premises — an area completely infested with pigeon droppings. It's clear this is a long-standing issue that the management has willfully ignored.

As a direct result of this, my vehicle suffered severe paint damage, with the outer layer peeling off due to the acidic contamination. The repair costs are estimated at INR 20,000, which is almost seven times what I paid for my stay. This is completely unacceptable and reflects a total disregard for guest property and satisfaction.

To say I am disappointed would be an understatement. This experience was not just inconvenient — it was financially damaging and deeply frustrating. I would strongly advise others to think twice before trusting the claims made by this establishment.

Avoid at all costs unless you're ready to pay a heavy price — quite literally — for your stay.

text.text:
Terrible experience – absolutely not worth four stars!

We stayed here for one night – and that was already one too many. Upon arrival, our driver was spoken to in a very rude manner and was not allowed to park the car at the hotel. There are also no facilities for drivers to stay overnight, which is something many travelers in India would reasonably expect.

The rooms were clean – and that’s the only positive point we can mention. The rest of the stay was extremely disappointing. Major construction work is currently going on, causing a lot of noise, dust, and an overall unpleasant atmosphere. This was never communicated to us beforehand – very dishonest towards guests.

Breakfast was a disgrace for a hotel that claims to be four-star quality. The so-called "continental" options were limited to some toast, butter, and fruit. The Indian breakfast had more variety, but most items smelled sour and seemed far from fresh. In the bar, we even saw cockroaches. The central air conditioning made such loud noise that sleeping was very difficult.

To make things worse, we were charged an additional 1800 INR for a simple camp bed for our driver – someone whose good night's rest is crucial for our safety.

We understand that renovations may be necessary, but communicate this clearly and temporarily close your doors if you cannot guarantee basic comfort. Right now, you are delivering an experience unworthy of the term "hotel."

Do not book here. It’s absolutely not worth your money.

I must say, the check-in experience was quite disappointing. The receptionist acted rather arrogantly, as if she were doing us a favor by letting us check in. The attitude and expressions were unnecessary and unwelcoming -- this definitely needs improvement.
Other staffs were good

Food:
We ordered lunch and dinner from the hotel and, honestly, it was below average. I’d recommend avoiding meals here altogether.
The breakfast buffet was decent, though probably the only saving grace foodwise.

Safety Concern :
This is something I really want to highlight.
Around 1AM, someone rang the bell claiming to be from the restaurant and asked if we had requested food to be reheated. I clearly hadn’t made any such request. He double-checked the room number and left, but the whole thing felt very fishy and unsettling.

I reported this to the reception. They said they would look into it,
I’m still unsure if it was a genuine mistake or something more serious --either way, this kind of experience is not acceptable, Please be cautious if you’re planning to stay here.

originalText.text:
I must say, the check-in experience was quite disappointing. The receptionist acted rather arrogantly, as if she were doing us a favor by letting us check in. The attitude and expressions were unnecessary and unwelcoming -- this definitely needs improvement.
Other staffs were good

Food:
We ordered lunch and dinner from the hotel and, honestly, it was below average. I’d recommend avoiding meals here altogether.
The breakfast buffet was decent, though probably the only saving grace foodwise.

Safety Concern :
This is something I really want to highlight.
Around 1AM, someone rang the bell claiming to be from the restaurant and asked if we had requested food to be reheated. I clearly hadn’t made any such request. He double-checked the room number and left, but the whole thing felt very fishy and unsettling.

I reported this to the reception. They said they would look into it,
I’m still unsure if it was a genuine mistake or something more serious --either way, this kind of experience is not acceptable, Please be cautious if you’re planning to stay here.

The overall experience was far from satisfying

Overall, it was a regrettable stay and I would not recommend this hotel to others. A serious improvement is needed in service, hospitality, and honesty in representation.

text.text: Convenient location… that about it! That’s all to it. Service is terrible! Staff (including managerial) is unaccommodating & unwelcoming. They do not honor made by the guests any requests. Hygiene is of concern. Housekeeping do not replace bed sheets & towels. Any requests made to housekeeping takes 1 - 2 hours I.e. if they honor your request. We had to wait about 7 hours once to get extra towels & bed sheets. A hotel running out of towels is unheard of. We requested for an ironing board & never got one at all. The house keeping staff’s attitude is as if they are doing you a favor. WiFi doesn’t work. No complaint gets resolved, even after complaining several times. If you’re looking for good service…. look elsewhere.

text.text:
Disappointing 4-Star Experience

I chose this hotel for a Drop Box appointment, expecting quality given its 4-star rating and location within the Great Express Avenue Mall. Unfortunately, my stay was subpar. The hotel's condition was concerning - dirty bathrooms, unclean towels and pillows, and lobby carpets with a strong unpleasant smell. Despite bringing the carpet issue to the manager's attention, it remained unaddressed. The only positives were the welcoming staff at the entrance and their help with our bags. Breakfast was just okay. Given the hotel's state and lack of attention to guest concerns, I'd say it falls short of even a 2-star standard. Not recommended for those seeking cleanliness and good service.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of visiting The Pride Hotel, Chennai yesterday, and I must say the experience was absolutely phenomenal! From the moment we stepped in, the hospitality was top-notch & every member of the staff made us feel incredibly welcome.

A special shout out to the Food and Beverage team their service was nothing short of outstanding. They were attentive, friendly & went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable dining experience.

We were lucky to catch the final day of a truly amazing food festival. The variety, flavors, and presentation of the dishes were simply outstanding! It’s unfortunate that it was the last day, because I would’ve loved to return for more.

The hotel features both a rooftop restaurant with a beautiful ambiance and a stylish ground floor restaurant, both serving delicious food & offering fantastic service. Whether you’re a guest at the hotel or just stopping by for a meal, I highly recommend dining at either location.

Kudos to the entire team at The Pride Hotel for creating such a wonderful atmosphere and delivering excellence at every level. We’ll definitely be back!

text.text:
We are from TCL - TATA Communications Ltd, Chennai. We recently (25-07-2025) hosted a Cocktail Party in Pavilion Hall at Hotel Pride Chennai, and the entire experience was exceptional from start to finish!

The venue was beautifully maintained, clean, and perfectly arranged. From the welcome drink and starters to the main course, every item on the menu was absolutely delicious—our guests were truly impressed. The bar counter setup was elegant and well-organized, adding a classy touch to the event.

A special mention to the F&B Manager Mr.Jyothi Sankar & team for serving everything with such warmth and a smile—their hospitality really stood out and created a wonderful atmosphere.

Heartfelt thanks to the F&B Manager and the Master Chef Mr.Ganesh & Mr.Sudeep for the excellent planning, execution, and flavors. Also, sincere appreciation to the Front Office Manager Mr.Alex and team for warmly receiving guests and guiding them smoothly to the event space.

Thanks as well to the Security team for efficiently managing the parking area, and to the Housekeeping manager Mr.Sridhar & team for keeping the venue spotless throughout.

Highly recommend Hotel Pride, Chennai for any Corporate Cocktail Party/Event—professional service, top-quality food, and a team that truly cares about delivering a great experience.

text.text:
Stayed here twice in the last 2 years and the quality has degraded significantly over time. The rooms are okay but the are washrooms aren’t clean and maintained anymore. Most of the taps and faucets hardly have any water coming through.
One major problem with this hotel is the parking. If you are not diligent about collecting the parking coupon and handing it at the mall parking exit, money will be automatically debited from your Fastag and the hotel takes no responsibility for it. We were unaware of this the first time, nor did the hotel inform us. So more than ₹800 got deducted from our Fastag and the hotel refused to provide any sort of compensation. Too disappointing.
Another thing to be mindful of is your ID proofs after check-in. The staff tends to forget to return them, and we noticed they had a huge stack of unclaimed IDs. So, be sure to collect yours before heading to your room.
Coming to the good part, the breakfast at Annam Cafe is great. Rooms have all the amenities. The hotel is designed in a unique and interesting fashion - truly a “Design Hotel”, lol.
Overall, not recommended for a stay anymore as the tariff is quite high for the current quality and maintenance.

Terrible experience overall. The hotel is inside Phoenix Marketcity, and there’s no proper direction or staff to help with parking. Reception was unmanned when we arrived — check-in got delayed. They didn’t mention the parking pass, so we got stuck at the toll gate for 20 minutes.

Room wasn’t cleaned after we went out — we had to ask at reception. Only one set of toiletries for two people. Gym pass given without any directions — later found out it’s inside the mall. TV didn’t work on the second day, and the only response was “maintenance hasn’t come.”

Breakfast was very basic and limited — definitely not what you expect from an expensive hotel. Poor service, poor communication, and no attention to detail. Not worth the money at all.

text.text:
This hotel is right on top of Phoenix mall. I liked the design here but it lacks function in many places and as the forgotten saying in architecture - form follows function. The standard room has a highly inaccessible area for the A/C controller and the tea/ coffee, milk sachets. The rooms could have been a little bit more tidier, the air conditioners had dust in them.  The third floor is where the cafe is and due to lack of ventilation in the passageway, there was a strong stench from the kitchen in the passageway (I dont think this is a cause of concern and it is just particular to my stay)
The reason I am giving 3.5/5 stars is because of the location with direct lift to the mall through Purple Chameleon restaurant, the discount you can get at this restaurant if you stay at the hotel and the courteous staff who prepared us breakfast before 7 AM (breakfast buffet starts at 7:30 AM ).
Its 25 minutes from the airport with moderate traffic and is a pleasant stay. Not bad value for money given how much other hotels but places like Southern comfort and Mount manor are cheaper but I have read that traffic noises are a bother in both of those places.

text.text:
I recently stayed here and had an average experience overall. The biggest downside for me was that outside food isn’t allowed, which was quite inconvenient. The stay itself was decent, but definitely overpriced for the quality of service provided. Rooms are descent but not worth the money. Breakfast complimentary was provided but not great.

I’d only recommend this place if you don’t mind spending a lot on something that doesn’t really offer value for money. Location is the only advantage.

text.text:
Our stay at Park Sabari was not just pleasant—it was truly heartwarming. What made it stand out for me was the way we were cared for, especially when it came to food. My parents are elderly and have multiple dietary restrictions, which often makes travelling and dining out a bit challenging for us as a family. We were unsure of how things would be managed, but what happened next genuinely moved us.

Mr. Kartick, who looked after us during our stay, was nothing short of a blessing. From the very beginning, he noticed the specific needs of my parents and took it upon himself to ensure they were comfortable and well taken care of. He didn’t just do his duty—he went above and beyond, often checking in personally, remembering their preferences, and serving food that was not only suitable for their health but also brought them a sense of home and comfort.

It felt like he wasn’t just serving guests—he was serving with care, empathy, and a big heart. Watching my parents enjoy their meals without worry, feeling relaxed and nurtured, meant the world to me. It’s not something we experience often, and I’ll always carry that with me.

To Mr. Kartick and the team at Park Sabari—thank you for not just providing service, but for offering genuine kindness. You made us feel at home, and for that, we’re truly grateful.

text.text:
Wonderful Stay with Amazing Hospitality at Gokulam Park Sabari!

I had the pleasure of staying at Gokulam Park Sabari last month with my family, and it was truly a memorable experience. From the moment we checked in, the staff made us feel right at home with their warm hospitality and attention to detail.

The highlight of our stay was the exceptional service at the Food & Beverage section. I want to especially mention Bivek and Anamika, who went out of their way to take excellent care of us. Their friendly attitude, professionalism, and genuine care really stood out. They made sure every meal was comfortable, delicious, and enjoyable, taking personal interest in our preferences and ensuring everything was perfect.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained, and the overall ambiance of the hotel was calm and welcoming. The entire property was neat, and the staff across departments were polite and helpful.

Thank you, Gokulam Park Sabari, for such a delightful stay. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great family-friendly place with top-notch service. We look forward to visiting again!

The taste of the food wasn’t bad, but the prices were unreasonably high for the quality. Definitely not worth the cost.

Overall I'm so satisfied
Thank you once again

text.text:
I wanted to take a moment to appreciate the wonderful experiences I’ve had at Halez. I always commend the spacious rooms, excellent amenities, and the hospitality of your staff. However, I’d like to bring to your attention a recurring concern regarding air conditioning.

On multiple occasions, I’ve noticed that the AC in the rooms is not cooling efficiently. While the team has been responsive in offering room changes, I believe a long-term solution would enhance the overall guest experience. Additionally, I’ve also felt that the cooling in the lobby could be improved to make it more comfortable. While sales and targets are crucial, guest experience plays an equally important role in long-term success.

Regarding the reception staff, I’ve seen some reviews about a particular female staff member being perceived as rude. However, from my personal experience, she has always been professional and efficient during my check-ins and check-outs. I do feel that if she isn’t smiling at times, it may simply mean something is off that day, rather than a reflection of her attitude. If she happens to read this, I just want to say she’s doing a great job, and I’d love to see a smile on her face!

Thank you for taking the time to consider this feedback. I truly appreciate the effort your team puts in and look forward to an even better stay next time.

text.text:
Halez Hotel in Chennai is a convenient stay option located about 45 minutes from the airport. Categorized as a 3-star property, it offers decent amenities including a swimming pool, spa, and an in-house bar. The rooms are of average size, making it a good fit for budget-conscious travelers seeking comfort without overspending.
What stands out at Halez is the warm and welcoming staff who are fluent in both Hindi and English, ensuring a smooth experience for guests from different regions. The food served at the hotel is reasonably good, offering value for money.
One of the highlights is their bar, Satori, where the experience goes beyond just drinks. With every beer order, they serve a generous complimentary platter of potato chips, mixture, peanuts, and a unique soybean-onion-lemon starter — a thoughtful and delightful touch that truly sets them apart.
Overall, Halez Hotel is a solid choice for those looking for affordable accommodation in Chennai with friendly service and a few pleasant surprises.

text.text:
Complete Fraud – Please Don’t Go by the Pictures!

I visited this property just 2 days ago, and it was a terrible experience. The place is not a proper hotel — it’s more like a shady set-up for couples only, located in an interior area with a very bad crowd around.

There is no proper reception, and the images shown on the website are heavily filtered — the reality is completely different. The property is a complete fraud. Once they take your money, they refuse to return it if you are not satisfied.

When I arrived, I couldn’t even stay for 5 minutes because of how unsafe and dirty the place was. The rooms aren’t even worth ₹500. When I asked for a refund, the property staff told me to contact MakeMyTrip. MakeMyTrip, in turn, blamed the property manager — clearly both are running this scam together.

Please don’t trust the pictures. I strongly advise everyone to avoid this property.

text.text: Extremely disappointing customer service experience. We had confirmed our booking and completed the payment in advance through agoda. However, upon arrival, the hotel staff flatly denied our reservation, citing overbooking and placing the entire blame on the portal. They showed no accountability or willingness to help resolve the situation. Instead, we were left stranded and were simply told to raise a refund request with the portal ourselves. There was no apology, no alternative offered.

Prior booking is recommended, especially on busy days.

Very disappointed with the experience.
*Worst customer service

* I've encountered—staff were rude and unhelpful. The place was *completely unhygienic
*, not maintained at all. Also, if you *book online, they won’t allow check-in before 12 PM*, no matter what. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

I had booked a Deluxe Room with breakfas through Goibibo, but the experience was extremely disappointing.
They gave me a substandard, unhygienic room instead, and the TV wasn’t working. At check-in, they demanded extra payment, claiming the amount paid via Goibibo wasn’t sufficient—even though I had already paid in full.

They also did not provide the breakfast that was included in my booking. Overall, it was the worst customer service, and the place was poorly maintained and unclean. I would not recommend this property to anyone.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Taj Vivanta Chennai for a delightful five-day work trip. From the moment I stepped foot into the hotel, I was greeted with warm hospitality and impeccable service. The hotel boasts a range of excellent amenities, including free access to the gym and swimming pool, making it an ideal choice for those seeking relaxation and wellness.

The first thing that caught my attention was the spaciousness and comfort of the rooms. The king-size beds provided a luxurious and restful sleep experience, ensuring that I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the day's adventures. The attention to detail in the room's design and furnishings was impressive, and I felt like every aspect was carefully curated to provide maximum comfort.

One standout feature of Taj Vivanta Chennai is the complimentary laundry service. They provided one pair of laundry free per day, which was incredibly convenient, especially for longer stays. This thoughtful gesture saved me the hassle of finding a laundromat or spending extra money on laundry services.

When it comes to dining, Taj Vivanta Chennai exceeded my expectations. The food served was consistently delicious, and the variety of options ensured that there was something to suit every palate. The culinary team showcased their expertise in both local and international cuisines, offering a delightful fusion of flavors. I particularly enjoyed the attentive and friendly service provided by the staff in the restaurants, making each dining experience memorable.

In terms of location, Taj Vivanta Chennai is situated approximately 30 kilometers away from the Chennai central railway station. While this may be a bit far for some travelers, the hotel's convenient location allows easy access to the city's attractions and landmarks. Getting to the hotel from the railway station is hassle-free, as cabs are readily available, providing a comfortable and quick journey.

Overall, my stay at Taj Vivanta Chennai was nothing short of exceptional. The combination of luxurious amenities, comfortable accommodations, delectable dining options, and attentive service made my experience truly memorable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure, as it offers a perfect blend of comfort, convenience, and hospitality.

text.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Vivanta Chennai, IT Expressway, and it was a delightful experience. The hotel is strategically located on the bustling IT corridor, making it a convenient choice for business travelers and tourists alike. The moment I arrived, I was impressed by the modern architecture and warm, welcoming ambiance.The check-in process was smooth, and the staff was incredibly courteous and attentive. My room was spacious, well-appointed, and featured a contemporary design with all the modern amenities one would expect from a premium hotel. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the cleanliness was impeccable. The bathroom was equipped with high-quality toiletries and had a luxurious feel.One of the highlights of my stay was dining at the hotel's restaurant. The diverse menu offered a range of delicious dishes, blending local flavors with international cuisine. The breakfast buffet, in particular, was extensive and catered to various tastes, providing a great start to the day.However, there were a couple of minor drawbacks. The pool area, while nice, was smaller than expected and can get crowded during peak hours. Additionally, the internet speed in my room was a bit inconsistent at times, which could be an area for improvement.Overall, my experience at Vivanta Chennai, IT Expressway, was very positive. The combination of excellent service, comfortable accommodations, and convenient location makes it a great choice for anyone visiting Chennai. I would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Vivanta by Taj in Chennai, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I arrived, I was treated to warm and gracious hospitality, which set the tone for a wonderful stay.

The hotel's modern and sleek design is impressive, with spacious rooms and suites that are tastefully decorated and equipped with all the amenities you'd expect from a luxury hotel. My room had a stunning view of the city, and the bed was incredibly comfortable.

The service at Vivanta by Taj is top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who go above and beyond to ensure that your stay is memorable. The concierge team was particularly helpful, assisting me with everything from restaurant reservations to transportation arrangements.

The hotel's dining options are also excellent, with a range of restaurants serving everything from traditional Indian cuisine to international fare. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which offered a vast array of options to suit every taste.

Overall, I would highly recommend Vivanta by Taj in Chennai to anyone looking for a luxurious and comfortable stay in the city.

_Recommended for:_ Business travelers, couples, families, luxury seekers.

text.text:
Exceptional Service of Raintree hotel St Mary’s Road

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Raintree St Mary’s Road and I must say, the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warmth and professionalism that set the tone for the entire stay.
The staff at Raintree went above and beyond to ensure that my needs were not only met but exceeded. Whether it was the front desk staff accommodating my requests with a smile or the housekeeping team maintaining impeccable cleanliness, every interaction was marked by a genuine commitment to customer satisfaction.
I failed to ask the name of the person who accommodated us but he was very sweet. A person with specs.
One aspect that truly stood out was the attention to detail. From the beautifully appointed rooms to the thoughtful amenities provided, it was evident that every aspect of the guest experience had been carefully considered.  Mr Ashlin is a well mannered and very helpful employee of the hotel and the way he interacts with guests is truly amazing. I’m truly glad Raintree has Ashlin working for them.
Moreover, the dining options were outstanding. The culinary team showcased their talent with a diverse menu that catered to a variety of tastes, and the quality of the food was exceptional. Kusum, preethy and Bapan were exceptional and I was surprised to see how caring and how well the senior staff were supporting their juniors by helping them clear the plates and handling guests. Not everywhere we get to see Senior managers help their junior staff to this extent
Overall, my stay at The Raintree St Mary’s Road  was nothing short of outstanding. The combination of impeccable service, attention to detail, and luxurious accommodations truly made for a memorable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a first-class stay.

text.text:
Title: A Luxurious Retreat at IBIS OMR : A Review of Excellence

Nestled along the pristine shores of Chennai OMR  the IBIS OMR,, stands as a beacon of luxury and tranquility. My recent stay at this exquisite establishment left me in awe of its impeccable service, stunning surroundings, and unparalleled hospitality. From the moment I stepped foot into the lobby to the day of my departure, every aspect of my experience at IBIS OMR exceeded my expectations.

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the friendly staff, but one individual truly stood out – Anchu, the epitome of hospitality. Anchu's genuine smile and impeccable professionalism immediately made me feel welcome and valued as a guest. Throughout my stay, she went above and beyond to ensure that every detail of my visit was taken care of, from arranging restaurant reservations to providing insightful recommendations for local attractions. Her dedication to excellence truly enhanced my stay and left a lasting impression.

The accommodation at IBIS OMR surpassed all expectations. My room,was with  elegantly appointed with modern amenities and luxurious furnishings. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect of the room, from the plush bedding to the tasteful decor. Each morning, I awoke to the gentle sound of waves lapping against the shore, a serene backdrop for the perfect start to the day.

One of the highlights of my stay was the culinary experience at Paradise Cove. The resort boasts a diverse array of dining options, each offering delectable cuisine crafted with the finest ingredients. From fresh seafood at the beachfront grill to gourmet international dishes at the fine dining restaurant, every meal was a culinary delight. Special mention must be made of Chef Miguel, whose culinary expertise shone through in every dish. His passion for food was evident in the exquisite flavors and presentation, leaving me eager to return for another gastronomic adventure.

Beyond the exceptional amenities and dining options, IBIS OMR offers an array of activities to suit every interest. there is no shortage of ways to unwind and embrace the beauty of paradise. The attentive staff at the resort's concierge desk, led by the efficient and knowledgeable Maria Martinez, were instrumental in arranging my activities and ensuring a seamless experience.

In addition to its luxurious amenities and breathtaking surroundings, what truly sets IBIS OMR apart is its unparalleled commitment to guest satisfaction. Every staff member I encountered during my stay, from the housekeeping team to the groundskeepers, exuded warmth and professionalism, creating a welcoming atmosphere that felt like home away from home. The genuine care and attention to detail demonstrated by each member of the IBIS OMR team truly set a new standard for hospitality excellence.

As I reluctantly bid farewell to IBIS OMR, I left with cherished memories and a profound appreciation for the exceptional experience provided by this remarkable resort. From the breathtaking natural beauty of its surroundings to the impeccable service and warm hospitality of its staff, Paradise Cove exceeded all expectations and left an indelible mark on my heart. My heartfelt thanks to Sarah Johnson and the entire team at Paradise Cove for an unforgettable stay. I eagerly anticipate my return to this slice of paradise in the near future.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Regenta Central RS Chennai OMR and had a pleasant overall experience. From check-in to check-out, the hospitality stood out, making my stay both comfortable and convenient.

The location is ideal for business travelers, especially those with meetings along the OMR corridor. It’s well-connected and easy to access from major IT hubs and offices. Despite being on a busy stretch, the hotel maintains a quiet, calm atmosphere inside.

Rooms were modern, clean, and well-maintained, with all the essential amenities—comfortable beds, crisp linens, a well-stocked minibar, and a clean bathroom. Housekeeping was prompt and did a great job every day. The Wi-Fi speed was reliable, which made working from the room seamless.

The restaurant served a good variety of dishes across cuisines, including some authentic South Indian options. The breakfast buffet was especially noteworthy with its range and freshness. Room service was also timely, and the food arrived warm and well-packed.

The staff at the front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant were courteous, professional, and always ready to help. I had a minor issue with the in-room AC, and the team responded quickly to fix it, which I appreciated.

Facilities like the gym and banquet halls seemed well-equipped and clean, though I didn’t have time to use them personally. There’s ample parking as well.

If I were to suggest an area for improvement, it would be to enhance soundproofing between rooms. I occasionally heard hallway noise.

Overall, a solid 4-star property that delivers on expectations. Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, Regenta Central RS is a reliable choice in Chennai OMR. I would happily consider staying here again.

Facilities like the gym and banquet halls seemed well-equipped and clean, though I didn’t have time to use them personally. There’s ample parking as well.

If I were to suggest an area for improvement, it would be to enhance soundproofing between rooms. I occasionally heard hallway noise.

Overall, a solid 4-star property that delivers on expectations. Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, Regenta Central RS is a reliable choice in Chennai OMR. I would happily consider staying here again.

text.text:
Location:
LemonTree in Mount Poonamalle, Chennai, is a hidden gem that offers the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility. Nestled away from the hustle and bustle of the city, this hotel is conveniently located for both leisure and business travelers. Situated just a short drive from the Chennai International Airport and key attractions like the Sriperumbudur Industrial Park, the hotel's location is a definite plus. The serene surroundings and lush greenery make it an ideal place to unwind after a busy day. The beautiful views of the surrounding landscape add to the overall charm of LemonTree, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a peaceful retreat.

Service:
The service at LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, is truly exceptional. From the moment you step into the hotel, you are greeted with warm smiles and a sense of genuine hospitality. The staff is courteous, attentive, and always ready to assist with any request. Whether it's arranging transportation, providing local recommendations, or attending to special dietary preferences, the staff goes above and beyond to ensure that guests have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Their professionalism and dedication to guest satisfaction are truly commendable and contribute significantly to the overall experience.

Food:
One of the standout features of LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, is its culinary offerings. The hotel's restaurant serves a delectable array of dishes that cater to diverse tastes. Whether you're in the mood for traditional South Indian cuisine or international fare, there's something for everyone. The breakfast buffet is particularly impressive, featuring a wide selection of dishes, including freshly prepared dosas, idlis, and an assortment of continental breakfast items. The quality of the food is excellent, and the presentation is top-notch. Moreover, the restaurant staff is attentive and ensures that your dining experience is nothing short of delightful.

In conclusion, LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, Chennai, is a fantastic choice for travelers looking for a peaceful retreat with easy access to key locations in the city. The hotel's exceptional service and delectable cuisine add to its appeal, making it a memorable destination for both business and leisure travelers. Whether you're seeking relaxation or a convenient base for your Chennai adventures, LemonTree delivers on all fronts, making it a top recommendation for your next visit to the area.

text.text:
It is an old hotel which has a well maintained facade. The lobby and corridors are beautifully decorated with elegant mirrors, old sculptures and wonderful paintings. The free breakfast provided for guests have a variety of Indian and Continental options, as well as a live counter.
The rooms are very spacious and are clean, but do need an upgrade. A TV, mini fridge, and kettle to make tea/coffee are provided. There needs to be more plug points. The bed is comfortable with huge pillows and a charming reclining headboard. The bathroom did not have proper drainage in the shower, nor ample cover to prevent spillage of water outside the shower area.
Room service is good and the doormen are polite and affable.
Overall, a good place for a stay.

The staff at the hotel were exceptional. They were friendly, attentive, and always went the extra mile to ensure my comfort and satisfaction. The service was truly top-notch.

Equally impressive was the hotel's restaurant. The food was delicious. I had a truly memorable dining experience.

Overall, my stay was exceptional. The combination of stunning design, impeccable service, and delicious food made it an unforgettable experience.

I recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a stylish and luxurious stay.

text.text:
Gokulam Park Sabari in Navalur has become my favorite place to stay in Chennai! This luxurious 4-star hotel offers an incredible experience, and here’s why it stands out:

Spacious and Elegant Rooms: The rooms are not only big but also beautifully designed with modern amenities. The bathroom is well-maintained and adds to the overall comfort.

Excellent Room Service and Friendly Staff: The room service is prompt, and the staff are exceptionally kind and helpful, making the stay even more enjoyable.

Prime Location: It's strategically located near Marina Mall, famous restaurants, and the ECR Beach, making it convenient to explore the best of Chennai.

Affordable Pricing: Despite offering luxury, the pricing is surprisingly affordable, making it a great choice for both comfort and value.

If you’re in Chennai and looking for a perfect stay, Gokulam Park Sabari is definitely the place to be!

I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Halez  recently, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I arrived, the warm and welcoming staff made me feel right at home.

The rooms were impeccably clean, spacious, and thoughtfully designed, providing the perfect balance of comfort and elegance. The attention to detail, from the plush bedding to the well-stocked amenities, made my stay incredibly relaxing.

The location is another big plus. It was convenient and made exploring the area effortless.

Overall,  Hotel Halez offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and outstanding service. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an unforgettable stay.

text.text:
I wanted to take a moment to appreciate the wonderful experiences I’ve had at Halez. I always commend the spacious rooms, excellent amenities, and the hospitality of your staff. However, I’d like to bring to your attention a recurring concern regarding air conditioning.

On multiple occasions, I’ve noticed that the AC in the rooms is not cooling efficiently. While the team has been responsive in offering room changes, I believe a long-term solution would enhance the overall guest experience. Additionally, I’ve also felt that the cooling in the lobby could be improved to make it more comfortable. While sales and targets are crucial, guest experience plays an equally important role in long-term success.

Regarding the reception staff, I’ve seen some reviews about a particular female staff member being perceived as rude. However, from my personal experience, she has always been professional and efficient during my check-ins and check-outs. I do feel that if she isn’t smiling at times, it may simply mean something is off that day, rather than a reflection of her attitude. If she happens to read this, I just want to say she’s doing a great job, and I’d love to see a smile on her face!

Thank you for taking the time to consider this feedback. I truly appreciate the effort your team puts in and look forward to an even better stay next time.

text.text:
Hotel Halez – A Memorable 3-Day Stay in Sholinganallur

I recently stayed at Hotel Halez, Sholinganallur for a family function and had an absolutely wonderful experience. We booked a Family Room for 3 days via Agoda at a special offer price of ₹10,000, and the deal included complimentary breakfast for all days. From check-in to checkout, the experience was warm, welcoming, and highly satisfying.

🛏️ Room & Amenities:

The room was spacious, spotlessly clean, and thoughtfully arranged.

The beds were plush and comfortable, and the room came with a study desk and a detailed booklet that included hotel policies, room service menu, and useful guest info.

There was a refreshment station with tea, coffee, milk powder, sugar sachets, and an electric kettle.

A mini fridge was also available, perfect for storing cold drinks or snacks.

There were windows, though our view was blocked by a nearby apartment—so we kept them closed. The other side of the hotel offers a beautiful pool view, so try to request that side if available.

Housekeeping was prompt, and towels/toiletries were always stocked.

🍽️ Breakfast – A Highlight!

The breakfast buffet exceeded our expectations. It was rich, diverse, and freshly prepared every day, catering to both South Indian and North Indian tastes.

Here’s a breakdown of what we enjoyed:

South Indian classics: Idli, Pongal, Upma, Poori, Vada, Sambar, and Chutneys.

Rotational items like Rava Pongal, Idiyappam, and special curries were included on alternate days.

Live counters for Dosa varieties and Omelette options were a big hit.

Bread with toaster, salads, and continental-style veggies like baked potatoes, sweet corn, baby corn, and banana.

Fresh fruits – Pineapple, Papaya, Watermelon – always chilled and juicy.

Sausages and warm curries complemented the spread.

Welcome drinks like Lychee, Watermelon, and Strawberry juices gave a refreshing start during breakfast.

And I must mention – their tea and coffee were blended beautifully with milk. Unlike the usual watery coffee in some hotels, this one was rich and flavorful. We really enjoyed it every morning.

🏊‍♂️ Facilities & Vibe:

The swimming pool was clean and well-maintained. My kid had a blast every time we visited it.

There’s a restaurant that’s open till 11:30 PM, which helped us on days we returned late from outings.

The hotel also houses a bar, and we noticed a well-behaved, mixed crowd of men, women, and couples enjoying the ambiance.

🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Hospitality:

This was another area where Hotel Halez shined. Every staff member we interacted with was genuinely welcoming and helpful. Their warmth was one of the reasons we extended our stay by an extra day – even though we had originally booked for just 2 nights.

📍 Location Benefits:

The hotel’s location in Sholinganallur made it easy for us to explore places on the ECR stretch:

VGP Marine Kingdom
ECR Beach
Mayajaal
Vandalur Zoo
Phoenix MarketCity

All of these were easily accessible with short travel times.

---

⭐ Final Verdict:

Hotel Halez in Sholinganallur gave us the perfect combination of comfort, service, and location.
Would definitely recommend for both families and business travelers. If you're looking for a clean, well-maintained hotel with great food and thoughtful hospitality in Chennai, this should be high on your list.
